bboxes.raw_text:
WASHINGTON degrading of
minority group employees in the
federal employment from rou-
tine jobs requiring little skill to
those demanding technical and
scientific training has been start
ed.


The recent job shift of Wash
ington civil servant to a prom
inent position in large Chicago
corporation gives us dramatic
evidence this new means Of open
ing employment opportunity to
all.


John E. Peele, Jr., a former
patent examiner in the United
States Patent Office. Department
Of Commerce, was recently en-
ployed as assistant patent counsel
by Bell and Howell Company. one
of the country s largest manufac-
turers of Photographic equip
ment.


The selection Of Mr.. Peele for
this responsible position was
based directly upon his extensive
background experience in pro-
cessing applications for patents
experience provided by the Fed
eral Government. His Is a skill
in great demand in private in
dustry and business but one which
can be obtained only in the
United States Patent Office.


Despite this good example. the
type Of job in government which
would prepare individuals for
employment in private industry
have not always been open simple
as a matter of course to Negroes.


An accepted policy of merit
employment has only become the
enforced policy of the Federal
overnment since the inception
of the President S Committee on
Equal Employment Opportunity
in 1861.

PATENT WORKER
LANDS JOB WITH
BELL AND HOWELL

MONTREAL, N. c. Southern
Presbyterians have started a
stronger civil rights policy by
ordering all white presbyteries
in seven southern states to absorb
three all Negro presbyteries
(presbyteries are districts).


The order affects North Caro-
lima, South Carolina, Georgia,
Mississippi, Alabama, Florida
and Louisiana. The area has 43
Negro churches with a member
ship of 1850.


Total membership in the south
east and southwest is 937 900.


Rev. John Miller of Mississippi
said this type of force would affect
the churches adversely.

Pacific States of Elks
the awards banquet held Sunday.


Seated above Emmett HARRISON of Oakland Calf, and Mrs.
Bessie l. Smith of San Diego, Calf.


included Mr. and Mrs. John Adams state secretaries
Of Berkeley Ruby Backshea Robert Richards lsia Ward
ruler Howard Falangan of Flagstaff
McElroy loyal DIT. ruler and Mrs. l. j. Pratt


The PISA convention be held In Phoenix June 2428.


welcome dinner for the officers of the Pacific States Assoca
the Eks held Saturday the Bali Hi Motel restaurant
PISA officers Secretary Dr. Ger
trude Bradley President Bessie Smith, President Emmett Hair
Chairman Esther McElroy and sh Ward exalted
ruler.


Standing Convention cocharman E. E. Bobo Maj Gen.
Matthew pscombe Thompson and James McElroy 3rd
president.

Southern Presbyteriuns
Begin lntegrution Plan
